sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Vicsek fractal.
message_1: A Vicsek fractal is created by iteratively replacing the middle third of each line segment with two shorter segments, each one-third of the length of the original segment. If the original line segment had length 27 cm, what is the total length of all the line segments in the Vicsek fractal after the 4th iteration?
message_2:
Let's analyze the pattern of the Vicsek fractal. In each iteration, we replace the middle third of each line segment with two shorter segments, each one-third of the length of the original segment. This means that in each iteration, the total length of the line segments increases by a factor of 4/3.

After the first iteration, the total length will be (4/3) * 27 cm.
After the second iteration, the total length will be (4/3)^2 * 27 cm.
After the third iteration, the total length will be (4/3)^3 * 27 cm.
After the fourth iteration, the total length will be (4/3)^4 * 27 cm.

So, the total length of all the line segments in the Vicsek fractal after the 4th iteration is:
